title: How to Be Lonely
text:
"How to Be Lonely" is a song by British singer <a href="Rita%20Ora">Rita Ora</a>, released as a single through <a href="Atlantic%20Records%20UK">Atlantic Records UK</a> on 13 March 2020. The song had limited success, reaching number 57 on the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a>.
Background.
Scottish singer-songwriter <a href="Lewis%20Capaldi">Lewis Capaldi</a> wrote "How to Be Lonely", but gave the song to Ora. "How to Be Lonely" is a <a href="mid-tempo">mid-tempo</a> ballad that deals with themes about "battling insecurity".
Critical reception.
Mike Wass of "<a href="Idolator%20%28website%29">Idolator</a>" wrote that the song is a "nice way to kick off an era" that "does showcase the '<a href="Anywhere%20%28Rita%20Ora%20song%29">Anywhere</a>' singer's powerful pipes and growth as an artist". Rob Copsey of the <a href="Official%20Charts%20Company">Official Charts Company</a> wrote that the song features "opening guitar strums[,] <a href="Coldplay">Coldplay</a>-sized chantalong chorus [and] catchy finger snaps, punchy electronic beats and some killer adlibs", concluding that Ora's "take on ugly crying powerhouse pop is masterfully done".
Music Video.
In the music video Rita is in an empty room alone then,where she was alone with a lot of people. The <a href="arrow">arrow</a> hits Rita. In the next scene she was walking in a room filled <a href="Eggshell">eggs</a>. She was dancing with a <a href="skeleton">skeleton</a> and <a href="bear">bear</a> hugging with her. After that, Rita falls into the <a href="sky">sky</a>,and having <a href="ant">ant</a>s on her face. Then she smashes the wall with a baseball bat. An <a href="Unidentified%20flying%20object">UFO</a> lands.
Live performances.
Ora performed the song live for the first time as part of the <a href="BBC">BBC</a>'s <a href="Sport%20Relief">Sport Relief</a> 2020 <a href="telethon">telethon</a> on 13 March. Poo
